step1.sentence: After six months of working weekends without a break, he completely burned out.

step2.story: The young nurse had thrown herself into her work from the first day on the job. By the end of her second year, she was burned out and could barely get out of bed in the mornings.

step3.story: Min had always been the most driven person in her study group. She never missed a deadline and always went beyond what was asked. But in the final semester, the workload piled too high and the pressure stopped feeling motivating. She burned out quietly, not all at once but in small pieces, until even opening a textbook felt impossible. Her advisor suggested a week off. She took two.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 과로나 과도한 스트레스로 인해 신체적, 정신적으로 극도로 지치다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 지속적인 과로나 스트레스로 인해 완전히 탈진한 상태를 나타낼 때 씁니다.
meaning.etymologyKo: burn(타다)과 out(완전히 소진)이 결합하여 에너지가 완전히 다 타버린다는 의미가 되었습니다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 단순한 피로가 아니라 장기적인 과부하로 인한 심각한 탈진을 나타냅니다. 회복하는 데 시간이 걸립니다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: If you keep working at this pace, you are going to burn out before the project ends.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 이 속도로 계속 일하면 프로젝트가 끝나기 전에 완전히 지쳐버릴 거예요.
